p: Fecundity and mortality tolerances of each Arabidopsis genotype were calculated as the slope of the linear regression of SW and LP, respectively, to virus accumulation considering both infected and mock-inoculated plants [ 12, 13]. Importantly, seed viability, estimated as per cent germination, did not significantly differ between mock-inoculated and infected plants ( χ 2 ≤ 3.12; p ≥ 0.102). Also, virus infection did not affect the weight of a single seed (Wald χ 2 ≤ 1.21; p ≥ 0.137). Thus, SW similarly reflects the number of viable seeds in both mock-inoculated and infected plants.
